newsitem.title: INDIA: Netherlands to offer financial package to India.
newsitem.headline: Netherlands to offer financial package to India.

text.p: The Netherlands is to offer a financial package and increase technical assistance to India, Dutch Minister for Foreign Trade Anneke van Dok said on Monday.
"I will meet Indian Finance Minister (P. Chidambaram) in the afternoon and discuss the financial package," van Dok told a news conference.
She did not give any details about the size of the package, but said the Netherlands would provide 45 percent of the package as grants. The remainder would have to be privately financed, she added.
"Since 1991 total direct approved investment from the Netherlands in India amounted to 950 million guilders," van Dok said.
The minister is leading a Dutch business delegation to India.
